Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֣י עָמ֔וֹס אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה בַנֹּקְדִ֖ים מִתְּק֑וֹעַ אֲשֶׁר֩ חָזָ֨ה עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֜ל בִּימֵ֣י ׀ עֻזִּיָּ֣ה מֶלֶךְ־יְהוּדָ֗ה וּבִימֵ֞י יָרׇבְעָ֤ם בֶּן־יוֹאָשׁ֙ מֶ֣לֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל שְׁנָתַ֖יִם לִפְנֵ֥י הָרָֽעַשׁ׃
Translated: The words of Amos, a sheep breeder from Tekoa, who prophesied concerning Israel in the reigns of Kings Uzziah of Judah and Jeroboam son of Joash of Israel, two years before the earthquake.
Transliteration: diverey amvos asher-hayah vanokediym mitekvoa asher chazah al-yisherael viymey uziyah melekhe-yehudah uviymey yarׇveam ven-yvoash melekhe yisherael shenatayiim lifeney haraash

Hebrew: וַיֹּאמַ֓ר ׀ יְהֹוָה֙ מִצִּיּ֣וֹן יִשְׁאָ֔ג וּמִירוּשָׁלַ֖͏ִם יִתֵּ֣ן קוֹל֑וֹ וְאָֽבְלוּ֙ נְא֣וֹת הָרֹעִ֔ים וְיָבֵ֖שׁ רֹ֥אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶֽל׃ {פ}
Translated:
He proclaimed:
GOD roars from Zion,
Shouts aloud from Jerusalem;
And the pastures of the shepherds shall languish,
And the summit of Carmel shall wither.
Transliteration: vayomar yehovah mitsiyyvon yisheag umiyrushala͏im yiten kvolvo veavelu nevot haroiym veyavesh rosh hakharemel {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י דַמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־דּוּשָׁ֛ם בַּחֲרֻצ֥וֹת הַבַּרְזֶ֖ל אֶת־הַגִּלְעָֽד׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Damascus,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they threshed Gilead
With threshing boards of iron.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey dameshek veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-dusham vacharutsvot havarezel et-hagilead

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּבֵ֣ית חֲזָאֵ֑ל וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנ֥וֹת בֶּן־הֲדָֽד׃
Translated:
I will send down fire upon the palace of Hazael,
And it shall devour the fortresses of Ben-hadad.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy esh veveyt chazael veakhelah aremenvot ven-hadad

Hebrew: וְשָֽׁבַרְתִּי֙ בְּרִ֣יחַ דַּמֶּ֔שֶׂק וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י יוֹשֵׁב֙ מִבִּקְעַת־אָ֔וֶן וְתוֹמֵ֥ךְ שֵׁ֖בֶט מִבֵּ֣ית עֶ֑דֶן וְגָל֧וּ עַם־אֲרָ֛ם קִ֖ירָה אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will break the gate bars of Damascus,
And wipe out the inhabitants from the Vale of Aven
And the sceptered ruler of Beth-eden;
And the people of Aram shall be exiled to Kir
—said GOD.
Transliteration: veshavaretiy veriycha dameshek vehikheratiy yvoshev mivikeat-aven vetvomekhe shevet miveyt eden vegalu am-aram kiyrah amar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י עַזָּ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־הַגְלוֹתָ֛ם גָּל֥וּת שְׁלֵמָ֖ה לְהַסְגִּ֥יר לֶאֱדֽוֹם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Gaza,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they exiled an entire population,
Which they delivered to Edom.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey azah veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-hagelvotam galut shelemah lehasegiyr leedvom

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּחוֹמַ֣ת עַזָּ֑ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנֹתֶֽיהָ׃
Translated:
I will send down fire upon the wall of Gaza,
And it shall devour its fortresses;
Transliteration: veshilachetiy esh vechvomat azah veakhelah aremenoteyha

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֤י יוֹשֵׁב֙ מֵֽאַשְׁדּ֔וֹד וְתוֹמֵ֥ךְ שֵׁ֖בֶט מֵֽאַשְׁקְל֑וֹן וַהֲשִׁיב֨וֹתִי יָדִ֜י עַל־עֶקְר֗וֹן וְאָֽבְדוּ֙ שְׁאֵרִ֣ית פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
And I will wipe out the inhabitants of Ashdod
And the sceptered ruler of Ashkelon;
And I will turn My hand against Ekron,
And the Philistines shall perish with no remnant
—said the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy yvoshev meashedvod vetvomekhe shevet meashekelvon vahashiyvvotiy yadiy al-ekervon veavedu sheeriyt felishetiym amar adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵי־צֹ֔ר וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־הַסְגִּירָ֞ם גָּל֤וּת שְׁלֵמָה֙ לֶאֱד֔וֹם וְלֹ֥א זָכְר֖וּ בְּרִ֥ית אַחִֽים׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Tyre,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they handed over
An entire population to Edom,
Ignoring the covenant of brotherhood.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey-tsor veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-hasegiyram galut shelemah leedvom velo zakheru veriyt achiym

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּח֣וֹמַת צֹ֑ר וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנוֹתֶֽיהָ׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will send down fire upon the wall of Tyre,
And it shall devour its fortresses.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy esh vechvomat tsor veakhelah aremenvoteyha {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י אֱד֔וֹם וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־רׇדְפ֨וֹ בַחֶ֤רֶב אָחִיו֙ וְשִׁחֵ֣ת רַחֲמָ֔יו וַיִּטְרֹ֤ף לָעַד֙ אַפּ֔וֹ וְעֶבְרָת֖וֹ שְׁמָ֥רָהֿ נֶֽצַח׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Edom,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because he pursued his brother with the sword
And repressed all pity,
Because his anger raged unceasing
And his fury stormed unchecked.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey edvom veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-rׇdefvo vacherev achiyv veshichet rachamayv vayiterof laad afvo veeveratvo shemarahֿ netsach

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בְּתֵימָ֑ן וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנ֥וֹת בׇּצְרָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will send down fire upon Teman,
And it shall devour the fortresses of Bozrah.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy esh veteyman veakhelah aremenvot vׇtserah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י בְנֵֽי־עַמּ֔וֹן וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־בִּקְעָם֙ הָר֣וֹת הַגִּלְעָ֔ד לְמַ֖עַן הַרְחִ֥יב אֶת־גְּבוּלָֽם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of the Ammonites,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they ripped open the pregnant women of Gilead
In order to enlarge their own territory.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey veney-amvon veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-vikeam harvot hagilead lemaan harechiyv et-gevulam

Hebrew: וְהִצַּ֤תִּי אֵשׁ֙ בְּחוֹמַ֣ת רַבָּ֔ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנוֹתֶ֑יהָ בִּתְרוּעָה֙ בְּי֣וֹם מִלְחָמָ֔ה בְּסַ֖עַר בְּי֥וֹם סוּפָֽה׃
Translated:
I will set fire to the wall of Rabbah,
And it shall devour its fortresses,
Amid shouting on a day of battle,
On a day of violent tempest.
Transliteration: vehitsatiy esh vechvomat ravah veakhelah aremenvoteyha viteruah veyvom milechamah vesaar veyvom sufah

Hebrew: וְהָלַ֥ךְ מַלְכָּ֖ם בַּגּוֹלָ֑ה ה֧וּא וְשָׂרָ֛יו יַחְדָּ֖ו אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Their king and his officers shall go
Into exile together
—said GOD.
Transliteration: vehalakhe malekham vagvolah hu vesharayv yachedav amar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י מוֹאָ֔ב וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־שׇׂרְפ֛וֹ עַצְמ֥וֹת מֶלֶךְ־אֱד֖וֹם לַשִּֽׂיד׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Moab,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because he burned the bones
Of the king of Edom to lime.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey mvoav veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-shׇrefvo atsemvot melekhe-edvom lashiyd

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּחְתִּי־אֵ֣שׁ בְּמוֹאָ֔ב וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנ֣וֹת הַקְּרִיּ֑וֹת וּמֵ֤ת בְּשָׁאוֹן֙ מוֹאָ֔ב בִּתְרוּעָ֖ה בְּק֥וֹל שׁוֹפָֽר׃
Translated:
I will send down fire upon Moab,
And it shall devour the fortresses of Kerioth.
And Moab shall die in tumult,
Amid shouting and the blare of horns;
Transliteration: veshilachetiy-esh vemvoav veakhelah aremenvot hakeriyyvot umet veshavon mvoav viteruah vekvol shvofar

Hebrew: וְהִכְרַתִּ֥י שׁוֹפֵ֖ט מִקִּרְבָּ֑הּ וְכׇל־שָׂרֶ֛יהָ אֶהֱר֥וֹג עִמּ֖וֹ אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will wipe out the ruler from within her
And slay all her officials along with him
—said GOD.
Transliteration: vehikheratiy shvofet mikirevah vekhׇl-shareyha ehervog imvo amar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יְהוּדָ֔ה וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַֽל־מׇאֳסָ֞ם אֶת־תּוֹרַ֣ת יְהֹוָ֗ה וְחֻקָּיו֙ לֹ֣א שָׁמָ֔רוּ וַיַּתְעוּם֙ כִּזְבֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־הָלְכ֥וּ אֲבוֹתָ֖ם אַחֲרֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Judah,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they have spurned the Teaching of GOD
And have not observed divine laws;
They are beguiled by the delusions
After which their ancestors walked.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey yehudah veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-mׇosam et-tvorat yehovah vechukayv lo shamaru vayateum khizeveyhem asher-halekhu avvotam achareyhem

Hebrew: וְשִׁלַּ֥חְתִּי אֵ֖שׁ בִּֽיהוּדָ֑ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אַרְמְנ֥וֹת יְרוּשָׁלָֽ͏ִם׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will send down fire upon Judah,
And it shall devour the fortresses of Jerusalem.
Transliteration: veshilachetiy esh viyhudah veakhelah aremenvot yerushala͏im {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֚ה אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֔ה עַל־שְׁלֹשָׁה֙ פִּשְׁעֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְעַל־אַרְבָּעָ֖ה לֹ֣א אֲשִׁיבֶ֑נּוּ עַל־מִכְרָ֤ם בַּכֶּ֙סֶף֙ צַדִּ֔יק וְאֶבְי֖וֹן בַּעֲב֥וּר נַעֲלָֽיִם׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
For three transgressions of Israel,
For four, I will not revoke the decree:
Because they have sold for silver
Those whose cause was just,
And the needy for a pair of sandals.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah al-sheloshah fisheey yisherael veal-arevaah lo ashiyvenu al-mikheram vakhesef tsadiyk veeveyvon vaavur naalayiim

Hebrew: הַשֹּׁאֲפִ֤ים עַל־עֲפַר־אֶ֙רֶץ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ דַּלִּ֔ים וְדֶ֥רֶךְ עֲנָוִ֖ים יַטּ֑וּ וְאִ֣ישׁ וְאָבִ֗יו יֵֽלְכוּ֙ אֶל־הַֽנַּעֲרָ֔ה לְמַ֥עַן חַלֵּ֖ל אֶת־שֵׁ֥ם קׇדְשִֽׁי׃
Translated:
[Ah,] you who trample the heads of the poor
Into the dust of the ground,
And make the humble walk a twisted course!
Father and son go to the same woman,
And thereby profane My holy name.
Transliteration: hashoafiym al-afar-erets verosh daliym vederekhe anaviym yatu veiysh veaviyv eilekhu el-hanaarah lemaan chalel et-shem kׇdeshiy

Hebrew: וְעַל־בְּגָדִ֤ים חֲבֻלִים֙ יַטּ֔וּ אֵ֖צֶל כׇּל־מִזְבֵּ֑חַ וְיֵ֤ין עֲנוּשִׁים֙ יִשְׁתּ֔וּ בֵּ֖ית אֱלֹהֵיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
They recline by every altar
On garments taken in pledge,
And drink in the House of their God
Wine bought with fines they imposed.
Transliteration: veal-vegadiym chavuliym yatu etsel khׇl-mizevecha veeiyn anushiym yishetu veyt eloheyhem

Hebrew: וְאָ֨נֹכִ֜י הִשְׁמַ֤דְתִּי אֶת־הָאֱמֹרִי֙ מִפְּנֵיהֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֨ר כְּגֹ֤בַהּ אֲרָזִים֙ גׇּבְה֔וֹ וְחָסֹ֥ן ה֖וּא כָּאַלּוֹנִ֑ים וָאַשְׁמִ֤יד פִּרְיוֹ֙ מִמַּ֔עַל וְשׇׁרָשָׁ֖יו מִתָּֽחַת׃
Translated:
Yet I
Destroyed the Amorite before them,
Whose stature was like the cedar’s
And who was stout as the oak,
Destroying his boughs above
And his trunk below!
Transliteration: veanokhiy hishemadetiy et-haemoriy mifeneyhem asher khegovah araziym gׇvehvo vechason hu khaalvoniym vaashemiyd fireyvo mimaal veshׇrashayv mitachat

Hebrew: וְאָנֹכִ֛י הֶעֱלֵ֥יתִי אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וָאוֹלֵ֨ךְ אֶתְכֶ֤ם בַּמִּדְבָּר֙ אַרְבָּעִ֣ים שָׁנָ֔ה לָרֶ֖שֶׁת אֶת־אֶ֥רֶץ הָאֱמֹרִֽי׃
Translated:
And I
Brought you up from the land of Egypt
And led you through the wilderness forty years,
To possess the land of the Amorite!
Transliteration: veanokhiy heeleytiy etekhem meerets mitserayiim vavolekhe etekhem vamidevar arevaiym shanah lareshet et-erets haemoriy

Hebrew: וָאָקִ֤ים מִבְּנֵיכֶם֙ לִנְבִיאִ֔ים וּמִבַּחוּרֵיכֶ֖ם לִנְזִרִ֑ים הַאַ֥ף אֵֽין־זֹ֛את בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
And I raised up prophets from among your sons
And nazirites from among your young men.
Is that not so, O people of Israel?
—says GOD.
Transliteration: vaakiym miveneykhem lineviyiym umivachureykhem lineziriym haaf eyn-zot veney yisherael neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וַתַּשְׁק֥וּ אֶת־הַנְּזִרִ֖ים יָ֑יִן וְעַל־הַנְּבִיאִים֙ צִוִּיתֶ֣ם לֵאמֹ֔ר לֹ֖א תִּנָּבְאֽוּ׃
Translated:
But you made the nazirites drink wine
And ordered the prophets not to prophesy.
Transliteration: vatasheku et-haneziriym yayiin veal-haneviyiym tsiviytem lemor lo tinaveu

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֛ה אָנֹכִ֥י מֵעִ֖יק תַּחְתֵּיכֶ֑ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר תָּעִיק֙ הָֽעֲגָלָ֔ה הַֽמְלֵאָ֥ה לָ֖הּ עָמִֽיר׃
Translated:
Ah, I will slow your movements
As a wagon is slowed
When it is full of cut grain.
Transliteration: hineh anokhiy meiyk tacheteykhem khaasher taiyk haagalah hameleah lah amiyr

Hebrew: וְאָבַ֤ד מָנוֹס֙ מִקָּ֔ל וְחָזָ֖ק לֹא־יְאַמֵּ֣ץ כֹּח֑וֹ וְגִבּ֖וֹר לֹא־יְמַלֵּ֥ט נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
Flight shall fail the swift,
The strong shall find no strength,
And the warrior shall not save his life.
Transliteration: veavad manvos mikal vechazak lo-yeamets khochvo vegivvor lo-yemalet nafeshvo

Hebrew: וְתֹפֵ֤שׂ הַקֶּ֙שֶׁת֙ לֹ֣א יַעֲמֹ֔ד וְקַ֥ל בְּרַגְלָ֖יו לֹ֣א יְמַלֵּ֑ט וְרֹכֵ֣ב הַסּ֔וּס לֹ֥א יְמַלֵּ֖ט נַפְשֽׁוֹ׃
Translated:
The archer shall not hold his ground,
And the fleet-footed shall not escape,
Nor the horseman save his life.
Transliteration: vetofesh hakeshet lo yaamod vekal veragelayv lo yemalet verokhev hasus lo yemalet nafeshvo

Hebrew: וְאַמִּ֥יץ לִבּ֖וֹ בַּגִּבּוֹרִ֑ים עָר֛וֹם יָנ֥וּס בַּיּוֹם־הַה֖וּא נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
Even the most stouthearted warrior
Shall run away unarmed that day
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: veamiyts livvo vagivvoriym arvom yanus vayyvom-hahu neum-yehovah {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֞וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר דִּבֶּ֧ר יְהֹוָ֛ה עֲלֵיכֶ֖ם בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עַ֚ל כׇּל־הַמִּשְׁפָּחָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֧ר הֶעֱלֵ֛יתִי מֵאֶ֥רֶץ מִצְרַ֖יִם לֵאמֹֽר׃
Translated:
Hear this word, O people of Israel,
That GOD has spoken concerning you,
Concerning the whole family that I brought up from the land of Egypt:
Transliteration: shimeu et-hadavar hazeh asher diver yehovah aleykhem veney yisherael al khׇl-hamishefachah asher heeleytiy meerets mitserayiim lemor

Hebrew: רַ֚ק אֶתְכֶ֣ם יָדַ֔עְתִּי מִכֹּ֖ל מִשְׁפְּח֣וֹת הָאֲדָמָ֑ה עַל־כֵּן֙ אֶפְקֹ֣ד עֲלֵיכֶ֔ם אֵ֖ת כׇּל־עֲוֺנֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
You alone have I singled out
Of all the families of the earth—
That is why I will call you to account
For all your iniquities.
Transliteration: rak etekhem yadaetiy mikhol mishefechvot haadamah al-khen efekod aleykhem et khׇl-avonoteykhem

Hebrew: הֲיֵלְכ֥וּ שְׁנַ֖יִם יַחְדָּ֑ו בִּלְתִּ֖י אִם־נוֹעָֽדוּ׃
Translated:
Can two walk together
Without having met?
Transliteration: haeilekhu shenayiim yachedav viletiy im-nvoadu

Hebrew: הֲיִשְׁאַ֤ג אַרְיֵה֙ בַּיַּ֔עַר וְטֶ֖רֶף אֵ֣ין ל֑וֹ הֲיִתֵּ֨ן כְּפִ֤יר קוֹלוֹ֙ מִמְּעֹ֣נָת֔וֹ בִּלְתִּ֖י אִם־לָכָֽד׃
Translated:
Does a lion roar in the forest
When it has no prey?
Does a great beast let out a cry from its den
Without having made a capture?
Transliteration: hayisheag areeih vayaar veteref eyn lvo hayiten khefiyr kvolvo mimeonatvo viletiy im-lakhad

Hebrew: הֲתִפֹּ֤ל צִפּוֹר֙ עַל־פַּ֣ח הָאָ֔רֶץ וּמוֹקֵ֖שׁ אֵ֣ין לָ֑הּ הֲיַֽעֲלֶה־פַּח֙ מִן־הָ֣אֲדָמָ֔ה וְלָכ֖וֹד לֹ֥א יִלְכּֽוֹד׃
Translated:
Does a bird drop on the ground—in a trap—
With no snare there?
Does a trap spring up from the ground
Unless it has caught something?
Transliteration: hatifol tsifvor al-fach haarets umvokesh eyn lah hayaaleh-fach min-haadamah velakhvod lo yilekhvod

Hebrew: אִם־יִתָּקַ֤ע שׁוֹפָר֙ בְּעִ֔יר וְעָ֖ם לֹ֣א יֶחֱרָ֑דוּ אִם־תִּֽהְיֶ֤ה רָעָה֙ בְּעִ֔יר וַיהֹוָ֖ה לֹ֥א עָשָֽׂה׃
Translated:
When a ram’s horn is sounded in a town,
Do the people not take alarm?
Can misfortune come to a town
If GOD has not caused it?
Transliteration: im-yitaka shvofar veiyr veam lo yecheradu im-tiheyeh raah veiyr vayhovah lo ashah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י לֹ֧א יַעֲשֶׂ֛ה אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה דָּבָ֑ר כִּ֚י אִם־גָּלָ֣ה סוֹד֔וֹ אֶל־עֲבָדָ֖יו הַנְּבִיאִֽים׃
Translated:
Indeed, my Sovereign GOD does nothing
Without having revealed the purpose
To God’s servants the prophets.
Transliteration: khiy lo yaasheh adonay yehovih davar khiy im-galah svodvo el-avadayv haneviyiym

Hebrew: אַרְיֵ֥ה שָׁאָ֖ג מִ֣י לֹ֣א יִירָ֑א אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ דִּבֶּ֔ר מִ֖י לֹ֥א יִנָּבֵֽא׃
Translated:
A lion has roared,
Who can but fear?
My Sovereign GOD has spoken,
Who can but prophesy?
Transliteration: areeih shaag miy lo yiyra adonay yehovih diver miy lo yinave

Hebrew: הַשְׁמִ֙יעוּ֙ עַל־אַרְמְנ֣וֹת בְּאַשְׁדּ֔וֹד וְעַֽל־אַרְמְנ֖וֹת בְּאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרָ֑יִם וְאִמְר֗וּ הֵאָֽסְפוּ֙ עַל־הָרֵ֣י שֹׁמְר֔וֹן וּרְא֞וּ מְהוּמֹ֤ת רַבּוֹת֙ בְּתוֹכָ֔הּ וַעֲשׁוּקִ֖ים בְּקִרְבָּֽהּ׃
Translated:
Proclaim in the fortresses of Ashdod
And in the fortresses of the land of Egypt!
Say:
Gather on the hill of Samaria
And witness the great outrages within her
And the oppression in her midst.
Transliteration: hashemiyu al-aremenvot veashedvod veal-aremenvot veerets mitserayiim veimeru heasefu al-harey shomervon ureu mehumot ravvot vetvokhah vaashukiym vekirevah

Hebrew: וְלֹא־יָדְע֥וּ עֲשׂוֹת־נְכֹחָ֖ה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הָא֥וֹצְרִ֛ים חָמָ֥ס וָשֹׁ֖ד בְּאַרְמְנוֹתֵיהֶֽם׃ {פ}
Translated:
They are incapable of doing right
—declares GOD;
They store up lawlessness and rapine
In their fortresses.
Transliteration: velo-yadeu ashvot-nekhochah neum-yehovah havotseriym chamas vashod vearemenvoteyhem {f}

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן כֹּ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה צַ֖ר וּסְבִ֣יב הָאָ֑רֶץ וְהוֹרִ֤יד מִמֵּךְ֙ עֻזֵּ֔ךְ וְנָבֹ֖זּוּ אַרְמְנוֹתָֽיִךְ׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Thus said the Sovereign GOD:
An enemy, all about the land!
He shall strip you of your splendor,
And your fortresses shall be plundered.
Transliteration: lakhen khoh amar adonay yehovih tsar useviyv haarets vehvoriyd mimekhe uzekhe venavozu aremenvotayiikhe

Hebrew: כֹּה֮ אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָה֒ כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ יַצִּ֨יל הָרֹעֶ֜ה מִפִּ֧י הָאֲרִ֛י שְׁתֵּ֥י כְרָעַ֖יִם א֣וֹ בְדַל־אֹ֑זֶן כֵּ֣ן יִנָּצְל֞וּ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הַיֹּֽשְׁבִים֙ בְּשֹׁ֣מְר֔וֹן בִּפְאַ֥ת מִטָּ֖ה וּבִדְמֶ֥שֶׁק עָֽרֶשׂ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD:
As a shepherd rescues from the lion’s jaws
Two shank bones or the tip of an ear,
So shall the Israelites escape
Who dwell in Samaria—
With the leg of a bed or the head of a couch.
Transliteration: khoh amar yehovah khaasher yatsiyl haroeh mifiy haariy shetey kheraayiim vo vedal-ozen khen yinatselu veney yisherael hayosheviym veshomervon vifeat mitah uvidemeshek aresh

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֥וּ וְהָעִ֖ידוּ בְּבֵ֣ית יַעֲקֹ֑ב נְאֻם־אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִ֖ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י הַצְּבָאֽוֹת׃
Translated:
Hear [this], and warn the House of Jacob
—says the Sovereign GOD, the God of Hosts—
Transliteration: shimeu vehaiydu veveyt yaakov neum-adonay yehovih elohey hatsevavot

Hebrew: כִּ֗י בְּי֛וֹם פׇּקְדִ֥י פִשְׁעֵֽי־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל עָלָ֑יו וּפָֽקַדְתִּי֙ עַל־מִזְבְּח֣וֹת בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וְנִגְדְּעוּ֙ קַרְנ֣וֹת הַמִּזְבֵּ֔חַ וְנָפְל֖וּ לָאָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
That when I punish Israel for its transgressions,
I will wreak judgment on the altar of Bethel,
And the horns of the altar shall be cut off
And shall fall to the ground.
Transliteration: khiy veyvom fׇkediy fisheey-yisherael alayv ufakadetiy al-mizevechvot veyt-el venigedeu karenvot hamizevecha venafelu laarets

Hebrew: וְהִכֵּיתִ֥י בֵית־הַחֹ֖רֶף עַל־בֵּ֣ית הַקָּ֑יִץ וְאָבְד֞וּ בָּתֵּ֣י הַשֵּׁ֗ן וְסָפ֛וּ בָּתִּ֥ים רַבִּ֖ים נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
I will wreck the winter palace
Together with the summer palace;
The ivory palaces shall be demolished,
And the great houses shall be destroyed
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vehikheytiy veyt-hachoref al-veyt hakayiits veavedu vatey hashen vesafu vatiym raviym neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֞וּ הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה פָּר֤וֹת הַבָּשָׁן֙ אֲשֶׁר֙ בְּהַ֣ר שֹׁמְר֔וֹן הָעֹשְׁק֣וֹת דַּלִּ֔ים הָרֹצְצ֖וֹת אֶבְיוֹנִ֑ים הָאֹמְרֹ֥ת לַאֲדֹנֵיהֶ֖ם הָבִ֥יאָה וְנִשְׁתֶּֽה׃
Translated:
Hear this word, you cows of Bashan
On the hill of Samaria—
Who defraud the poor,
Who rob the needy;
Who say to your husbands,
“Bring, and let’s carouse!”
Transliteration: shimeu hadavar hazeh farvot havashan asher vehar shomervon haoshekvot daliym harotsetsvot eveyvoniym haomerot laadoneyhem haviyah venisheteh

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֨ע אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ בְּקׇדְשׁ֔וֹ כִּ֛י הִנֵּ֥ה יָמִ֖ים בָּאִ֣ים עֲלֵיכֶ֑ם וְנִשָּׂ֤א אֶתְכֶם֙ בְּצִנּ֔וֹת וְאַחֲרִֽיתְכֶ֖ן בְּסִיר֥וֹת דּוּגָֽה׃
Translated:
My Sovereign GOD swears irrevocably:
Behold, days are coming upon you
When you will be carried off in baskets,
And, to the last one, in fish baskets,
Transliteration: nisheva adonay yehovih vekׇdeshvo khiy hineh yamiym vaiym aleykhem venisha etekhem vetsinvot veachariytekhen vesiyrvot dugah

Hebrew: וּפְרָצִ֥ים תֵּצֶ֖אנָה אִשָּׁ֣ה נֶגְדָּ֑הּ וְהִשְׁלַכְתֶּ֥נָה הַהַרְמ֖וֹנָה נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
And taken out [of the city]—
Each one through a breach straight ahead—
And flung on the refuse heap
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: uferatsiym tetsenah ishah negedah vehishelakhetenah haharemvonah neum-yehovah

Hebrew: בֹּ֤אוּ בֵֽית־אֵל֙ וּפִשְׁע֔וּ הַגִּלְגָּ֖ל הַרְבּ֣וּ לִפְשֹׁ֑עַ וְהָבִ֤יאוּ לַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ זִבְחֵיכֶ֔ם לִשְׁלֹ֥שֶׁת יָמִ֖ים מַעְשְׂרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Come to Bethel and transgress;
To Gilgal, and transgress even more:
Present your sacrifices the next morning
And your tithes on the third day;
Transliteration: vou veyt-el ufisheu hagilegal harevu lifeshoa vehaviyu lavoker zivecheykhem lisheloshet yamiym maesheroteykhem

Hebrew: וְקַטֵּ֤ר מֵֽחָמֵץ֙ תּוֹדָ֔ה וְקִרְא֥וּ נְדָב֖וֹת הַשְׁמִ֑יעוּ כִּ֣י כֵ֤ן אֲהַבְתֶּם֙ בְּנֵ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃
Translated:
And burn a thank offering of leavened bread;
And proclaim freewill offerings loudly.
For you love that sort of thing, O Israelites
—declares the Sovereign GOD.
Transliteration: vekater mechamets tvodah vekireu nedavvot hashemiyu khiy khen ahavetem veney yisherael neum adonay yehovih

Hebrew: וְגַם־אֲנִי֩ נָתַ֨תִּי לָכֶ֜ם נִקְי֤וֹן שִׁנַּ֙יִם֙ בְּכׇל־עָ֣רֵיכֶ֔ם וְחֹ֣סֶר לֶ֔חֶם בְּכֹ֖ל מְקוֹמֹֽתֵיכֶ֑ם וְלֹא־שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָדַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
I, on My part, have given you
Cleanness of teeth in all your towns,
And lack of food in all your settlements.
Yet you did not turn back to Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: vegam-aniy natatiy lakhem nikeyvon shinayiim vekhׇl-areykhem vechoser lechem vekhol mekvomoteykhem velo-shavetem aday neum-yehovah

Hebrew: וְגַ֣ם אָנֹכִי֩ מָנַ֨עְתִּי מִכֶּ֜ם אֶת־הַגֶּ֗שֶׁם בְּע֨וֹד שְׁלֹשָׁ֤ה חֳדָשִׁים֙ לַקָּצִ֔יר וְהִמְטַרְתִּי֙ עַל־עִ֣יר אֶחָ֔ת וְעַל־עִ֥יר אַחַ֖ת לֹ֣א אַמְטִ֑יר חֶלְקָ֤ה אַחַת֙ תִּמָּטֵ֔ר וְחֶלְקָ֛ה אֲשֶֽׁר־לֹֽא־תַמְטִ֥יר עָלֶ֖יהָ תִּיבָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
I therefore withheld the rain from you
Three months before harvesttime:
I would make it rain on one town
And not on another;
One field would be rained upon
While another on which it did not rain
Would wither.
Transliteration: vegam anokhiy manaetiy mikhem et-hageshem vevod sheloshah chodashiym lakatsiyr vehimetaretiy al-iyr echat veal-iyr achat lo ametiyr chelekah achat timater vechelekah asher-lo-tametiyr aleyha tiyvash

Hebrew: וְנָע֡וּ שְׁתַּ֩יִם֩ שָׁלֹ֨שׁ עָרִ֜ים אֶל־עִ֥יר אַחַ֛ת לִשְׁתּ֥וֹת מַ֖יִם וְלֹ֣א יִשְׂבָּ֑עוּ וְלֹֽא־שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָדַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
So two or three towns would wander
To a single town to drink water,
But their thirst would not be slaked.
Yet you did not turn back to Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: venau shetayiim shalosh ariym el-iyr achat lishetvot mayiim velo yishevau velo-shavetem aday neum-yehovah

Hebrew: הִכֵּ֣יתִי אֶתְכֶם֮ בַּשִּׁדָּפ֣וֹן וּבַיֵּרָקוֹן֒ הַרְבּ֨וֹת גַּנּוֹתֵיכֶ֧ם וְכַרְמֵיכֶ֛ם וּתְאֵנֵיכֶ֥ם וְזֵיתֵיכֶ֖ם יֹאכַ֣ל הַגָּזָ֑ם וְלֹא־שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָדַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated:
I scourged you with blight and mildew;
Repeatedly your gardens and vineyards,
Your fig trees and olive trees
Were devoured by locusts.
Yet you did not turn back to Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: hikheytiy etekhem vashidafvon uvayerakvon harevvot ganvoteykhem vekharemeykhem uteeneykhem vezeyteykhem yokhal hagazam velo-shavetem aday neum-yehovah {s}

Hebrew: שִׁלַּ֨חְתִּי בָכֶ֥ם דֶּ֙בֶר֙ בְּדֶ֣רֶךְ מִצְרַ֔יִם הָרַ֤גְתִּי בַחֶ֙רֶב֙ בַּח֣וּרֵיכֶ֔ם עִ֖ם שְׁבִ֣י סוּסֵיכֶ֑ם וָאַעֲלֶ֞ה בְּאֹ֤שׁ מַֽחֲנֵיכֶם֙ וּֽבְאַפְּכֶ֔ם וְלֹֽא־שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָדַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
I sent against you pestilence
In the manner of Egypt;
I slew your young men with the sword,
Together with your captured horses,
And I made the stench of your armies
Rise in your very nostrils.
Yet you did not turn back to Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: shilachetiy vakhem dever vederekhe mitserayiim haragetiy vacherev vachureykhem im sheviy suseykhem vaaaleh veosh machaneykhem uveafekhem velo-shavetem aday neum-yehovah

Hebrew: הָפַ֣כְתִּי בָכֶ֗ם כְּמַהְפֵּכַ֤ת אֱלֹהִים֙ אֶת־סְדֹ֣ם וְאֶת־עֲמֹרָ֔ה וַתִּהְי֕וּ כְּא֖וּד מֻצָּ֣ל מִשְּׂרֵפָ֑ה וְלֹא־שַׁבְתֶּ֥ם עָדַ֖י נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
I have wrought destruction among you
As when God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah;
You have become like a brand plucked from burning.
Yet you have not turned back to Me
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: hafakhetiy vakhem khemahefekhat Elohim et-sedom veet-amorah vatiheyu kheud mutsal misherefah velo-shavetem aday neum-yehovah

Hebrew: לָכֵ֕ן כֹּ֥ה אֶעֱשֶׂה־לְּךָ֖ יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל עֵ֚קֶב כִּי־זֹ֣את אֶעֱשֶׂה־לָּ֔ךְ הִכּ֥וֹן לִקְרַאת־אֱלֹהֶ֖יךָ יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Because I am doing that to you,
Even so will I act toward you, O Israel—
Prepare to meet your God, O Israel!
Transliteration: lakhen khoh eesheh-lekha yisherael ekev khiy-zot eesheh-lakhe hikhvon likerat-eloheykha yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֡י הִנֵּה֩ יוֹצֵ֨ר הָרִ֜ים וּבֹרֵ֣א ר֗וּחַ וּמַגִּ֤יד לְאָדָם֙ מַה־שֵּׂח֔וֹ עֹשֵׂ֥ה שַׁ֙חַר֙ עֵיפָ֔ה וְדֹרֵ֖ךְ עַל־בָּ֣מֳתֵי אָ֑רֶץ יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Behold the One who formed the mountains,
And created the wind,
And whose wishes have been made known to mortals,
Who turns blackness into daybreak,
And treads upon the high places of the earth,
Whose name is GOD—the God of Hosts.
Transliteration: khiy hineh yvotser hariym uvore rucha umagiyd leadam mah-shechvo osheh shachar eyfah vedorekhe al-vamotey arets yehovah elohey-tsevavot shemvo {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְע֞וּ אֶת־הַדָּבָ֣ר הַזֶּ֗ה אֲשֶׁ֨ר אָנֹכִ֜י נֹשֵׂ֧א עֲלֵיכֶ֛ם קִינָ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Hear this word that I intone
As a dirge over you, O House of Israel:
Transliteration: shimeu et-hadavar hazeh asher anokhiy noshe aleykhem kiynah veyt yisherael

Hebrew: נָֽפְלָה֙ לֹא־תוֹסִ֣יף ק֔וּם בְּתוּלַ֖ת יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל נִטְּשָׁ֥ה עַל־אַדְמָתָ֖הּ אֵ֥ין מְקִימָֽהּ׃
Translated:
Fallen, not to rise again,
Is Maiden Israel;
Abandoned on her soil
With none to lift her up.
Transliteration: nafelah lo-tvosiyf kum vetulat yisherael niteshah al-adematah eyn mekiymah

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֤ה אָמַר֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה הָעִ֛יר הַיֹּצֵ֥את אֶ֖לֶף תַּשְׁאִ֣יר מֵאָ֑ה וְהַיּוֹצֵ֥את מֵאָ֛ה תַּשְׁאִ֥יר עֲשָׂרָ֖ה לְבֵ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
For thus said the Sovereign GOD
About the House of Israel:
The town that marches out a thousand strong
Shall have a hundred left,
And the one that marches out a hundred strong
Shall have but ten left.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar adonay yehovih haiyr hayotset elef tasheiyr meah vehayyvotset meah tasheiyr asharah leveyt yisherael

Hebrew: כִּ֣י כֹ֥ה אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֖ה לְבֵ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל דִּרְשׁ֖וּנִי וִֽחְיֽוּ׃
Translated:
Thus said GOD
To the House of Israel:
Seek Me, and you will live.
Transliteration: khiy khoh amar yehovah leveyt yisherael direshuniy vicheyu

Hebrew: וְאַֽל־תִּדְרְשׁוּ֙ בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל וְהַגִּלְגָּל֙ לֹ֣א תָבֹ֔אוּ וּבְאֵ֥ר שֶׁ֖בַע לֹ֣א תַעֲבֹ֑רוּ כִּ֤י הַגִּלְגָּל֙ גָּלֹ֣ה יִגְלֶ֔ה וּבֵֽית־אֵ֖ל יִהְיֶ֥ה לְאָֽוֶן׃
Translated:
Do not seek Bethel,
Nor go to Gilgal,
Nor cross over to Beer-sheba;
For Gilgal shall go into exile,
And Bethel shall become a delusion.
Transliteration: veal-tidereshu veyt-el vehagilegal lo tavou uveer sheva lo taavoru khiy hagilegal galoh yigeleh uveyt-el yiheyeh leaven

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁ֥וּ אֶת־יְהֹוָ֖ה וִֽחְי֑וּ פֶּן־יִצְלַ֤ח כָּאֵשׁ֙ בֵּ֣ית יוֹסֵ֔ף וְאָכְלָ֥ה וְאֵין־מְכַבֶּ֖ה לְבֵֽית־אֵֽל׃
Translated:
Seek GOD, and you will live.
Otherwise, [God] will rush like fire upon the House of Joseph
And consume Bethel with none to quench it.
Transliteration: direshu et-yehovah vicheyu fen-yitselach khaesh veyt yvosef veakhelah veeyn-mekhaveh leveyt-el

Hebrew: הַהֹפְכִ֥ים לְלַעֲנָ֖ה מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה לָאָ֥רֶץ הִנִּֽיחוּ׃
Translated:
[Ah,] you who turn justice into wormwood
And hurl righteousness to the ground!
[Seek GOD,]
Transliteration: hahofekhiym lelaanah mishefat utsedakah laarets hiniychu

Hebrew: עֹשֵׂ֨ה כִימָ֜ה וּכְסִ֗יל וְהֹפֵ֤ךְ לַבֹּ֙קֶר֙ צַלְמָ֔וֶת וְי֖וֹם לַ֣יְלָה הֶחְשִׁ֑יךְ הַקּוֹרֵ֣א לְמֵֽי־הַיָּ֗ם וַֽיִּשְׁפְּכֵ֛ם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ יְהֹוָ֥ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Who made the Pleiades and Orion,
Who turns deep darkness into dawn
And darkens day into night,
Who summons the waters of the sea
And pours them out upon the earth—
Whose name is GOD!
Transliteration: osheh khiymah ukhesiyl vehofekhe lavoker tsalemavet veyvom layelah hecheshiykhe hakvore lemey-hayam vayishefekhem al-feney haarets yehovah shemvo

Hebrew: הַמַּבְלִ֥יג שֹׁ֖ד עַל־עָ֑ז וְשֹׁ֖ד עַל־מִבְצָ֥ר יָבֽוֹא׃
Translated:
It is [God] who hurls destruction upon strongholds,
So that ruin comes upon fortresses!
Transliteration: hamaveliyg shod al-az veshod al-mivetsar yavvo

Hebrew: שָׂנְא֥וּ בַשַּׁ֖עַר מוֹכִ֑יחַ וְדֹבֵ֥ר תָּמִ֖ים יְתָעֵֽבוּ׃
Translated:
They hate the arbiter in the gate,
And detest the one whose plea is just.
Transliteration: shaneu vashaar mvokhiycha vedover tamiym yetaevu

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן יַ֣עַן בּוֹשַׁסְכֶ֞ם עַל־דָּ֗ל וּמַשְׂאַת־בַּר֙ תִּקְח֣וּ מִמֶּ֔נּוּ בָּתֵּ֥י גָזִ֛ית בְּנִיתֶ֖ם וְלֹא־תֵ֣שְׁבוּ בָ֑ם כַּרְמֵי־חֶ֣מֶד נְטַעְתֶּ֔ם וְלֹ֥א תִשְׁתּ֖וּ אֶת־יֵינָֽם׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Because you impose a tax on the poor
And exact from them a levy of grain,
You have built houses of hewn stone,
But you shall not live in them;
You have planted delightful vineyards,
But shall not drink their wine.
Transliteration: lakhen yaan vvoshasekhem al-dal umasheat-var tikechu mimenu vatey gaziyt veniytem velo-teshevu vam kharemey-chemed netaetem velo tishetu et-eiynam

Hebrew: כִּ֤י יָדַ֙עְתִּי֙ רַבִּ֣ים פִּשְׁעֵיכֶ֔ם וַעֲצֻמִ֖ים חַטֹּאתֵיכֶ֑ם צֹרְרֵ֤י צַדִּיק֙ לֹ֣קְחֵי כֹ֔פֶר וְאֶבְיוֹנִ֖ים בַּשַּׁ֥עַר הִטּֽוּ׃
Translated:
For I have noted how many are your crimes,
And how countless your sins—
You enemies of the righteous,
You takers of bribes,
You who subvert in the gate
The cause of the needy!
Transliteration: khiy yadaetiy raviym fisheeykhem vaatsumiym chatoteykhem tsorerey tsadiyk lokechey khofer veeveyvoniym vashaar hitu

Hebrew: לָכֵ֗ן הַמַּשְׂכִּ֛יל בָּעֵ֥ת הַהִ֖יא יִדֹּ֑ם כִּ֛י עֵ֥ת רָעָ֖ה הִֽיא׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
At such a time the prudent keep silent,
For it is an evil time.
Transliteration: lakhen hamashekhiyl vaet hahiy yidom khiy et raah hiy

Hebrew: דִּרְשׁוּ־ט֥וֹב וְאַל־רָ֖ע לְמַ֣עַן תִּֽחְי֑וּ וִיהִי־כֵ֞ן יְהֹוָ֧ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־צְבָא֛וֹת אִתְּכֶ֖ם כַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר אֲמַרְתֶּֽם׃
Translated:
Seek good and not evil,
That you may live,
And that the ETERNAL, the God of Hosts,
May truly be with you,
As you think.
Transliteration: direshu-tvov veal-ra lemaan ticheyu viyhiy-khen yehovah elohey-tsevavot itekhem khaasher amaretem

Hebrew: שִׂנְאוּ־רָע֙ וְאֶ֣הֱבוּ ט֔וֹב וְהַצִּ֥יגוּ בַשַּׁ֖עַר מִשְׁפָּ֑ט אוּלַ֗י יֶחֱנַ֛ן יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁאֵרִ֥ית יוֹסֵֽף׃ {ס}
Translated:
Hate evil and love good,
And establish justice in the gate;
Perhaps the ETERNAL, the God of Hosts,
Will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph.
Transliteration: shineu-ra veehevu tvov vehatsiygu vashaar mishefat ulay yechenan yehovah elohey-tsevavot sheeriyt yvosef {s}

Hebrew: לָ֠כֵ֠ן כֹּֽה־אָמַ֨ר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֱלֹהֵ֤י צְבָאוֹת֙ אֲדֹנָ֔י בְּכׇל־רְחֹב֣וֹת מִסְפֵּ֔ד וּבְכׇל־חוּצ֖וֹת יֹאמְר֣וּ הוֹ־ה֑וֹ וְקָרְא֤וּ אִכָּר֙ אֶל־אֵ֔בֶל וּמִסְפֵּ֖ד אֶל־י֥וֹדְעֵי נֶֽהִי׃
Translated:
Assuredly,
Thus said GOD,
The Sovereign—the God of Hosts:
In every square there shall be lamenting,
In every street cries of “Ah, woe!”
And the farm hand shall be
Called to mourn,
And those skilled in wailing
To lament;
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah elohey tsevavot adonay vekhׇl-rechovvot misefed uvekhׇl-chutsvot yomeru hvo-hvo vekareu ikhar el-evel umisefed el-yvodeey nehiy

Hebrew: וּבְכׇל־כְּרָמִ֖ים מִסְפֵּ֑ד כִּֽי־אֶעֱבֹ֥ר בְּקִרְבְּךָ֖ אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
For there shall be lamenting
In every vineyard, too,
When I pass through your midst
—said GOD.
Transliteration: uvekhׇl-kheramiym misefed khiy-eevor vekirevekha amar yehovah {f}

Hebrew: ה֥וֹי הַמִּתְאַוִּ֖ים אֶת־י֣וֹם יְהֹוָ֑ה לָמָּה־זֶּ֥ה לָכֶ֛ם י֥וֹם יְהֹוָ֖ה הוּא־חֹ֥שֶׁךְ וְלֹא־אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
Ah, you who wish
For the day of GOD!
Why should you want
The day of GOD?
It shall be darkness, not light!
Transliteration: hvoy hamiteaviym et-yvom yehovah lamah-zeh lakhem yvom yehovah hu-choshekhe velo-vor

Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר יָנ֥וּס אִישׁ֙ מִפְּנֵ֣י הָאֲרִ֔י וּפְגָע֖וֹ הַדֹּ֑ב וּבָ֣א הַבַּ֔יִת וְסָמַ֤ךְ יָדוֹ֙ עַל־הַקִּ֔יר וּנְשָׁכ֖וֹ הַנָּחָֽשׁ׃
Translated:
—As if someone were to run from a lion
And get attacked by a bear;
Or, upon making it indoors,
Were to lean their hand on the wall
And get bitten by a snake!
Transliteration: khaasher yanus iysh mifeney haariy ufegavo hadov uva havayiit vesamakhe yadvo al-hakiyr uneshakhvo hanachash

Hebrew: הֲלֹא־חֹ֛שֶׁךְ י֥וֹם יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹא־א֑וֹר וְאָפֵ֖ל וְלֹא־נֹ֥גַֽהּ לֽוֹ׃
Translated:
Surely the day of GOD shall be
Not light, but darkness,
Blackest night without a glimmer.
Transliteration: halo-choshekhe yvom yehovah velo-vor veafel velo-nogah lvo

Hebrew: שָׂנֵ֥אתִי מָאַ֖סְתִּי חַגֵּיכֶ֑ם וְלֹ֥א אָרִ֖יחַ בְּעַצְּרֹתֵיכֶֽם׃
Translated:
I loathe, I spurn your festivals,
I am not appeased by your solemn assemblies.
Transliteration: shanetiy maasetiy chageykhem velo ariycha veatseroteykhem

Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־תַּעֲלוּ־לִ֥י עֹל֛וֹת וּמִנְחֹתֵיכֶ֖ם לֹ֣א אֶרְצֶ֑ה וְשֶׁ֥לֶם מְרִיאֵיכֶ֖ם לֹ֥א אַבִּֽיט׃
Translated:
If you offer Me burnt offerings—or your grain offerings—
I will not accept them;
I will pay no heed
To your gifts of fatlings.
Transliteration: khiy im-taalu-liy olvot uminechoteykhem lo eretseh veshelem meriyeykhem lo aviyt

Hebrew: הָסֵ֥ר מֵעָלַ֖י הֲמ֣וֹן שִׁרֶ֑יךָ וְזִמְרַ֥ת נְבָלֶ֖יךָ לֹ֥א אֶשְׁמָֽע׃
Translated:
Spare Me the sound of your hymns,
And let Me not hear the music of your lutes.
Transliteration: haser mealay hamvon shireykha vezimerat nevaleykha lo eshema

Hebrew: וְיִגַּ֥ל כַּמַּ֖יִם מִשְׁפָּ֑ט וּצְדָקָ֖ה כְּנַ֥חַל אֵיתָֽן׃
Translated:
But let justice well up like water,
Righteousness like an unfailing stream.
Transliteration: veyigal khamayiim mishefat utsedakah khenachal eytan

Hebrew: הַזְּבָחִ֨ים וּמִנְחָ֜ה הִֽגַּשְׁתֶּם־לִ֧י בַמִּדְבָּ֛ר אַרְבָּעִ֥ים שָׁנָ֖ה בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Did you offer sacrifice and oblation to Me
Those forty years in the wilderness,
O House of Israel?
Transliteration: hazevachiym uminechah higashetem-liy vamidevar arevaiym shanah veyt yisherael

Hebrew: וּנְשָׂאתֶ֗ם אֵ֚ת סִכּ֣וּת מַלְכְּכֶ֔ם וְאֵ֖ת כִּיּ֣וּן צַלְמֵיכֶ֑ם כּוֹכַב֙ אֱלֹ֣הֵיכֶ֔ם אֲשֶׁ֥ר עֲשִׂיתֶ֖ם לָכֶֽם׃
Translated:
And you shall carry off your “king”—
Sikkuth and Kiyyun,
The images you have made for yourselves
Of your astral deity—
Transliteration: uneshatem et sikhut malekhekhem veet khiyyun tsalemeykhem khvokhav eloheykhem asher ashiytem lakhem

Hebrew: וְהִגְלֵיתִ֥י אֶתְכֶ֖ם מֵהָ֣לְאָה לְדַמָּ֑שֶׂק אָמַ֛ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֵֽי־צְבָא֖וֹת שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
As I drive you into exile beyond Damascus
—Said GOD, whose name is God of Hosts.
Transliteration: vehigeleytiy etekhem mehaleah ledamashek amar yehovah elohey-tsevavot shemvo {f}

Hebrew: ה֚וֹי הַשַּׁאֲנַנִּ֣ים בְּצִיּ֔וֹן וְהַבֹּטְחִ֖ים בְּהַ֣ר שֹׁמְר֑וֹן נְקֻבֵי֙ רֵאשִׁ֣ית הַגּוֹיִ֔ם וּבָ֥אוּ לָהֶ֖ם בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated:
Ah, you who are at ease in Zion
And confident on the hill of Samaria,
You notables of the leading nation
On whom the House of Israel pin their hopes:
Transliteration: hvoy hashaananiym vetsiyyvon vehavotechiym vehar shomervon nekuvey reshiyt hagvoyim uvau lahem veyt yisherael

Hebrew: עִבְר֤וּ כַֽלְנֵה֙ וּרְא֔וּ וּלְכ֥וּ מִשָּׁ֖ם חֲמַ֣ת רַבָּ֑ה וּרְד֣וּ גַת־פְּלִשְׁתִּ֗ים הֲטוֹבִים֙ מִן־הַמַּמְלָכ֣וֹת הָאֵ֔לֶּה אִם־רַ֥ב גְּבוּלָ֖ם מִגְּבֻלְכֶֽם׃
Translated:
Cross over to Calneh and see,
Go from there to Great Hamath,
And go down to Gath of the Philistines:
Are [you] better than those kingdoms,
Or is their territory larger than yours?
Transliteration: iveru khaleneh ureu ulekhu misham chamat ravah uredu gat-felishetiym hatvoviym min-hamamelakhvot haeleh im-rav gevulam migevulekhem

Hebrew: הַֽמְנַדִּ֖ים לְי֣וֹם רָ֑ע וַתַּגִּשׁ֖וּן שֶׁ֥בֶת חָמָֽס׃
Translated:
Yet you ward off [the thought of] a day of woe
And convene a session of lawlessness.
Transliteration: hamenadiym leyvom ra vatagishun shevet chamas

Hebrew: הַשֹּֽׁכְבִים֙ עַל־מִטּ֣וֹת שֵׁ֔ן וּסְרֻחִ֖ים עַל־עַרְשׂוֹתָ֑ם וְאֹכְלִ֤ים כָּרִים֙ מִצֹּ֔אן וַעֲגָלִ֖ים מִתּ֥וֹךְ מַרְבֵּֽק׃
Translated:
They lie on ivory beds,
Lolling on their couches,
Feasting on lambs from the flock
And on calves from the stalls.
Transliteration: hashokheviym al-mitvot shen useruchiym al-areshvotam veokheliym khariym mitson vaagaliym mitvokhe marevek

Hebrew: הַפֹּרְטִ֖ים עַל־פִּ֣י הַנָּ֑בֶל כְּדָוִ֕יד חָשְׁב֥וּ לָהֶ֖ם כְּלֵי־שִֽׁיר׃
Translated:
They hum snatches of song
To the tune of the lute—
They account themselves musicians like David.
Transliteration: haforetiym al-fiy hanavel khedaviyd chashevu lahem kheley-shiyr

Hebrew: הַשֹּׁתִ֤ים בְּמִזְרְקֵי֙ יַ֔יִן וְרֵאשִׁ֥ית שְׁמָנִ֖ים יִמְשָׁ֑חוּ וְלֹ֥א נֶחְל֖וּ עַל־שֵׁ֥בֶר יוֹסֵֽף׃
Translated:
They drink [straight] from the wine bowls
And anoint themselves with the choicest oils—
But they are not concerned about the ruin of Joseph.
Transliteration: hashotiym vemizerekey yayiin vereshiyt shemaniym yimeshachu velo nechelu al-shever yvosef

Hebrew: לָכֵ֛ן עַתָּ֥ה יִגְל֖וּ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ גֹּלִ֑ים וְסָ֖ר מִרְזַ֥ח סְרוּחִֽים׃
Translated:
Assuredly, right soon
They shall head the column of exiles;
They shall loll no more at festive meals.
Transliteration: lakhen atah yigelu verosh goliym vesar mirezach seruchiym

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּע֩ אֲדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֜ה בְּנַפְשׁ֗וֹ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָה֙ אֱלֹהֵ֣י צְבָא֔וֹת מְתָאֵ֤ב אָנֹכִי֙ אֶת־גְּא֣וֹן יַעֲקֹ֔ב וְאַרְמְנֹתָ֖יו שָׂנֵ֑אתִי וְהִסְגַּרְתִּ֖י עִ֥יר וּמְלֹאָֽהּ׃
Translated:
The Sovereign GOD wholeheartedly swears:
I loathe the Pride of Jacob,
And I detest his fortresses.
I will declare forfeit city and inhabitants alike
—declares the ETERNAL, the God of Hosts.
Transliteration: nisheva adonay yehovih venafeshvo neum-yehovah elohey tsevavot metaev anokhiy et-gevon yaakov vearemenotayv shanetiy vehisegaretiy iyr umeloah

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־יִוָּ֨תְר֜וּ עֲשָׂרָ֧ה אֲנָשִׁ֛ים בְּבַ֥יִת אֶחָ֖ד וָמֵֽתוּ׃
Translated: If ten people are left in one house, they shall die.
Transliteration: vehayah im-yivateru asharah anashiym vevayiit echad vametu

Hebrew: וּנְשָׂא֞וֹ דּוֹד֣וֹ וּמְסָֽרְפ֗וֹ לְהוֹצִ֣יא עֲצָמִים֮ מִן־הַבַּיִת֒ וְאָמַ֞ר לַאֲשֶׁ֨ר בְּיַרְכְּתֵ֥י הַבַּ֛יִת הַע֥וֹד עִמָּ֖ךְ וְאָמַ֣ר אָ֑פֶס וְאָמַ֣ר הָ֔ס כִּ֛י לֹ֥א לְהַזְכִּ֖יר בְּשֵׁ֥ם יְהֹוָֽה׃ {ס}
Translated: And if someone’s kinsman—who is to burn incense for one of the deceased—comes to carry the remains out of the house, and he calls to the one at the rear of the house, “Are there any alive besides you?” the answer will be, “No, none.” And he will say, “Hush!”—so that no one may utter G<small>OD</small>’s name.
Transliteration: uneshavo dvodvo umesarefvo lehvotsiy atsamiym min-havayit veamar laasher veyarekhetey havayiit havod imakhe veamar afes veamar has khiy lo lehazekhiyr veshem yehovah {s}

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה יְהֹוָה֙ מְצַוֶּ֔ה וְהִכָּ֛ה הַבַּ֥יִת הַגָּד֖וֹל רְסִיסִ֑ים וְהַבַּ֥יִת הַקָּטֹ֖ן בְּקִעִֽים׃
Translated:
For GOD will command,
And the great house shall be smashed to bits,
And the little house to splinters.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh yehovah metsaveh vehikhah havayiit hagadvol resiysiym vehavayiit hakaton vekiiym

Hebrew: הַיְרֻצ֤וּן בַּסֶּ֙לַע֙ סוּסִ֔ים אִֽם־יַחֲר֖וֹשׁ בַּבְּקָרִ֑ים כִּֽי־הֲפַכְתֶּ֤ם לְרֹאשׁ֙ מִשְׁפָּ֔ט וּפְרִ֥י צְדָקָ֖ה לְלַעֲנָֽה׃
Translated:
Can horses gallop on a rock?
Can it be plowed with oxen?
Yet you have turned justice into poison weed
And the fruit of righteousness to wormwood.
Transliteration: hayerutsun vasela susiym im-yacharvosh vavekariym khiy-hafakhetem lerosh mishefat uferiy tsedakah lelaanah

Hebrew: הַשְּׂמֵחִ֖ים לְלֹ֣א דָבָ֑ר הָאֹ֣מְרִ֔ים הֲל֣וֹא בְחׇזְקֵ֔נוּ לָקַ֥חְנוּ לָ֖נוּ קַרְנָֽיִם׃
Translated:
[Ah,] those who are so happy about Lo-dabar,
Who exult, “By our might
We have captured Karnaim”!
Transliteration: hashemechiym lelo davar haomeriym halvo vechׇzekenu lakachenu lanu karenayiim

Hebrew: כִּ֡י הִנְנִי֩ מֵקִ֨ים עֲלֵיכֶ֜ם בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֛ה אֱלֹהֵ֥י הַצְּבָא֖וֹת גּ֑וֹי וְלָחֲצ֥וּ אֶתְכֶ֛ם מִלְּב֥וֹא חֲמָ֖ת עַד־נַ֥חַל הָעֲרָבָֽה׃ {פ}
Translated:
But I, O House of Israel,
Will raise up a nation against you
—declares the ETERNAL, the God of Hosts—
Who will harass you from Lebo-hamath
To the Wadi Arabah.
Transliteration: khiy hineniy mekiym aleykhem veyt yisherael neum-yehovah elohey hatsevavot gvoy velachatsu etekhem milevvo chamat ad-nachal haaravah {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה הִרְאַ֙נִי֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְהִנֵּה֙ יוֹצֵ֣ר גֹּבַ֔י בִּתְחִלַּ֖ת עֲל֣וֹת הַלָּ֑קֶשׁ וְהִ֨נֵּה־לֶ֔קֶשׁ אַחַ֖ר גִּזֵּ֥י הַמֶּֽלֶךְ׃
Translated: This is what my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> showed me: [A plague of] locusts was created at the time when the late-sown crops were beginning to sprout—the late-sown crops after the king’s reaping.
Transliteration: khoh hireaniy adonay yehovih vehineh yvotser govay vitechilat alvot halakesh vehineh-lekesh achar gizey hamelekhe

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֗ה אִם־כִּלָּה֙ לֶֽאֱכוֹל֙ אֶת־עֵ֣שֶׂב הָאָ֔רֶץ וָֽאֹמַ֗ר אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ סְֽלַֽח־נָ֔א מִ֥י יָק֖וּם יַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּ֥י קָטֹ֖ן הֽוּא׃
Translated: When it had finished devouring the herbage in the land, I said, “O my Sovereign, E<small>TERNAL</small> One, pray forgive. How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”
Transliteration: vehayah im-khilah leekhvol et-eshev haarets vaomar adonay yehovih selach-na miy yakum yaakov khiy katon hu

Hebrew: נִחַ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־זֹ֑את לֹ֥א תִֽהְיֶ֖ה אָמַ֥ר יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> relented concerning this. “It shall not come to pass,” said G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: nicham yehovah al-zot lo tiheyeh amar yehovah

Hebrew: כֹּ֤ה הִרְאַ֙נִי֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְהִנֵּ֥ה קֹרֵ֛א לָרִ֥ב בָּאֵ֖שׁ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וַתֹּ֙אכַל֙ אֶת־תְּה֣וֹם רַבָּ֔ה וְאָכְלָ֖ה אֶת־הַחֵֽלֶק׃
Translated: This is what my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> showed me: Lo, my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> was summoning to contend by fire that consumed the Great Deep and was consuming the fields.
Transliteration: khoh hireaniy adonay yehovih vehineh kore lariv vaesh adonay yehovih vatokhal et-tehvom ravah veakhelah et-hachelek

Hebrew: וָאֹמַ֗ר אֲדֹנָ֤י יֱהֹוִה֙ חֲדַל־נָ֔א מִ֥י יָק֖וּם יַעֲקֹ֑ב כִּ֥י קָטֹ֖ן הֽוּא׃
Translated: I said, “Oh, my Sovereign, E<small>TERNAL</small> One, refrain! How will Jacob survive? He is so small.”
Transliteration: vaomar adonay yehovih chadal-na miy yakum yaakov khiy katon hu

Hebrew: נִחַ֥ם יְהֹוָ֖ה עַל־זֹ֑את גַּם־הִיא֙ לֹ֣א תִֽהְיֶ֔ה אָמַ֖ר אֲדֹנָ֥י יֱהֹוִֽה׃ {פ}
Translated: G<small>OD</small> relented concerning this. “That shall not come to pass, either,” said my Sovereign G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: nicham yehovah al-zot gam-hiy lo tiheyeh amar adonay yehovih {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֣ה הִרְאַ֔נִי וְהִנֵּ֧ה אֲדֹנָ֛י נִצָּ֖ב עַל־חוֹמַ֣ת אֲנָ֑ךְ וּבְיָד֖וֹ אֲנָֽךְ׃
Translated: This is what I was shown: [God] was standing on a wall checked with a plumb line while holding a plumb line.
Transliteration: khoh hireaniy vehineh adonay nitsav al-chvomat anakhe uveyadvo anakhe

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י מָֽה־אַתָּ֤ה רֹאֶה֙ עָמ֔וֹס וָאֹמַ֖ר אֲנָ֑ךְ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֲדֹנָ֗י הִנְנִ֨י שָׂ֤ם אֲנָךְ֙ בְּקֶ֙רֶב֙ עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־אוֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד עֲב֥וֹר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: And G<small>OD</small> asked me, “What do you see, Amos?” “A plumb line,” I replied. And my Sovereign declared, “I am going to apply a plumb line to My people Israel; I will pardon them no more.
Transliteration: vayomer yehovah elay mah-atah roeh amvos vaomar anakhe vayomer adonay hineniy sham anakhe vekerev amiy yisherael lo-vosiyf vod avvor lvo

Hebrew: וְנָשַׁ֙מּוּ֙ בָּמ֣וֹת יִשְׂחָ֔ק וּמִקְדְּשֵׁ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל יֶחֱרָ֑בוּ וְקַמְתִּ֛י עַל־בֵּ֥ית יָרׇבְעָ֖ם בֶּחָֽרֶב׃ {ס}
Translated: The shrines of Isaac shall be laid waste, and the sanctuaries of Israel reduced to ruins; and I will turn upon the House of Jeroboam with the sword.”
Transliteration: venashamu vamvot yishechak umikedeshey yisherael yecheravu vekametiy al-veyt yarׇveam vecharev {s}

Hebrew: וַיִּשְׁלַ֗ח אֲמַצְיָה֙ כֹּהֵ֣ן בֵּֽית־אֵ֔ל אֶל־יָרׇבְעָ֥ם מֶלֶךְ־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל לֵאמֹ֑ר קָשַׁ֨ר עָלֶ֜יךָ עָמ֗וֹס בְּקֶ֙רֶב֙ בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־תוּכַ֣ל הָאָ֔רֶץ לְהָכִ֖יל אֶת־כׇּל־דְּבָרָֽיו׃
Translated: Amaziah, the priest of Bethel, sent this message to King Jeroboam of Israel: “Amos is conspiring against you within the House of Israel. The country cannot endure the things he is saying.
Transliteration: vayishelach amatseyah khohen veyt-el el-yarׇveam melekhe-yisherael lemor kashar aleykha amvos vekerev veyt yisherael lo-tukhal haarets lehakhiyl et-khׇl-devarayv

Hebrew: כִּי־כֹה֙ אָמַ֣ר עָמ֔וֹס בַּחֶ֖רֶב יָמ֣וּת יָרׇבְעָ֑ם וְיִ֨שְׂרָאֵ֔ל גָּלֹ֥ה יִגְלֶ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃ {ס}
Translated: For Amos has said, ‘Jeroboam shall die by the sword, and Israel shall be exiled from its soil.’”
Transliteration: khiy-khoh amar amvos vacherev yamut yarׇveam veyisherael galoh yigeleh meal adematvo {s}

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֲמַצְיָה֙ אֶל־עָמ֔וֹס חֹזֶ֕ה לֵ֥ךְ בְּרַח־לְךָ֖ אֶל־אֶ֣רֶץ יְהוּדָ֑ה וֶאֱכׇל־שָׁ֣ם לֶ֔חֶם וְשָׁ֖ם תִּנָּבֵֽא׃
Translated: Amaziah also said to Amos, “Seer, off with you to the land of Judah! Earn your living there, and do your prophesying there.
Transliteration: vayomer amatseyah el-amvos chozeh lekhe verach-lekha el-erets yehudah veekhׇl-sham lechem vesham tinave

Hebrew: וּבֵֽית־אֵ֔ל לֹא־תוֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד לְהִנָּבֵ֑א כִּ֤י מִקְדַּשׁ־מֶ֙לֶךְ֙ ה֔וּא וּבֵ֥ית מַמְלָכָ֖ה הֽוּא׃
Translated: But don’t ever prophesy again at Bethel; for it is a king’s sanctuary and a royal palace.”
Transliteration: uveyt-el lo-tvosiyf vod lehinave khiy mikedash-melekhe hu uveyt mamelakhah hu

Hebrew: וַיַּ֤עַן עָמוֹס֙ וַיֹּ֣אמֶר אֶל־אֲמַצְיָ֔ה לֹא־נָבִ֣יא אָנֹ֔כִי וְלֹ֥א בֶן־נָבִ֖יא אָנֹ֑כִי כִּי־בוֹקֵ֥ר אָנֹ֖כִי וּבוֹלֵ֥ס שִׁקְמִֽים׃
Translated: Amos answered Amaziah: “I am not a prophet, and I am not a prophet’s disciple. I am a cattle breeder and a tender of sycamore figs.
Transliteration: vayaan amvos vayomer el-amatseyah lo-naviy anokhiy velo ven-naviy anokhiy khiy-vvoker anokhiy uvvoles shikemiym

Hebrew: וַיִּקָּחֵ֣נִי יְהֹוָ֔ה מֵאַחֲרֵ֖י הַצֹּ֑אן וַיֹּ֤אמֶר אֵלַי֙ יְהֹוָ֔ה לֵ֥ךְ הִנָּבֵ֖א אֶל־עַמִּ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃
Translated: But G<small>OD</small> took me away from following the flock, and G<small>OD</small> said to me, ‘Go, prophesy to My people Israel.’
Transliteration: vayikacheniy yehovah meacharey hatson vayomer elay yehovah lekhe hinave el-amiy yisherael

Hebrew: וְעַתָּ֖ה שְׁמַ֣ע דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֑ה אַתָּ֣ה אֹמֵ֗ר לֹ֤א תִנָּבֵא֙ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל וְלֹ֥א תַטִּ֖יף עַל־בֵּ֥ית יִשְׂחָֽק׃
Translated: And so, hear the word of G<small>OD</small>. You say I must not prophesy about the House of Israel or preach about the House of Isaac;
Transliteration: veatah shema devar-yehovah atah omer lo tinave al-yisherael velo tatiyf al-veyt yishechak

Hebrew: לָכֵ֞ן כֹּה־אָמַ֣ר יְהֹוָ֗ה אִשְׁתְּךָ֞ בָּעִ֤יר תִּזְנֶה֙ וּבָנֶ֤יךָ וּבְנֹתֶ֙יךָ֙ בַּחֶ֣רֶב יִפֹּ֔לוּ וְאַדְמָתְךָ֖ בַּחֶ֣בֶל תְּחֻלָּ֑ק וְאַתָּ֗ה עַל־אֲדָמָ֤ה טְמֵאָה֙ תָּמ֔וּת וְיִ֨שְׂרָאֵ֔ל גָּלֹ֥ה יִגְלֶ֖ה מֵעַ֥ל אַדְמָתֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated: but this, I swear, is what G<small>OD</small> said: Your wife shall play the whore in the town, your sons and daughters shall fall by the sword, and your land shall be divided up with a measuring line. And you yourself shall die on impure soil; for Israel shall be exiled from its soil.”
Transliteration: lakhen khoh-amar yehovah ishetekha vaiyr tizeneh uvaneykha uvenoteykha vacherev yifolu veadematekha vachevel techulak veatah al-adamah temeah tamut veyisherael galoh yigeleh meal adematvo {f}

Hebrew: כֹּ֥ה הִרְאַ֖נִי אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה וְהִנֵּ֖ה כְּל֥וּב קָֽיִץ׃
Translated: This is what my Sovereign G<small>OD</small> showed me: There was a basket of figs.
Transliteration: khoh hireaniy adonay yehovih vehineh kheluv kayiits

Hebrew: וַיֹּ֗אמֶר מָֽה־אַתָּ֤ה רֹאֶה֙ עָמ֔וֹס וָאֹמַ֖ר כְּל֣וּב קָ֑יִץ וַיֹּ֨אמֶר יְהֹוָ֜ה אֵלַ֗י בָּ֤א הַקֵּץ֙ אֶל־עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל לֹא־אוֹסִ֥יף ע֖וֹד עֲב֥וֹר לֽוֹ׃
Translated: I was asked, “What do you see, Amos?” “A basket of figs,” I replied. And G<small>OD</small> said to me: “The hour of doom has come for My people Israel; I will not pardon them again.
Transliteration: vayomer mah-atah roeh amvos vaomar kheluv kayiits vayomer yehovah elay va hakets el-amiy yisherael lo-vosiyf vod avvor lvo

Hebrew: וְהֵילִ֜ילוּ שִׁיר֤וֹת הֵיכָל֙ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא נְאֻ֖ם אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֑ה רַ֣ב הַפֶּ֔גֶר בְּכׇל־מָק֖וֹם הִשְׁלִ֥יךְ הָֽס׃ {פ}
Translated:
And the singing women of the palace shall howl on that day—declares the Sovereign GOD:
So many corpses
Left lying everywhere!
Hush!”
Transliteration: veheyliylu shiyrvot heykhal vayyvom hahu neum adonay yehovih rav hafeger vekhׇl-makvom hisheliykhe has {f}

Hebrew: שִׁמְעוּ־זֹ֕את הַשֹּׁאֲפִ֖ים אֶבְי֑וֹן וְלַשְׁבִּ֖ית (ענוי) [עֲנִיֵּי־]אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated: Listen to this, you who devour the needy, annihilating the poor of the land,
Transliteration: shimeu-zot hashoafiym eveyvon velasheviyt (nvy) [aniyey-]arets

Hebrew: לֵאמֹ֗ר מָתַ֞י יַעֲבֹ֤ר הַחֹ֙דֶשׁ֙ וְנַשְׁבִּ֣ירָה שֶּׁ֔בֶר וְהַשַּׁבָּ֖ת וְנִפְתְּחָה־בָּ֑ר לְהַקְטִ֤ין אֵיפָה֙ וּלְהַגְדִּ֣יל שֶׁ֔קֶל וּלְעַוֵּ֖ת מֹאזְנֵ֥י מִרְמָֽה׃
Translated: saying, “If only the new moon were over, so that we could sell grain; the sabbath, so that we could offer wheat for sale, using an ephah that is too small, and a shekel that is too big, tilting a dishonest scale,
Transliteration: lemor matay yaavor hachodesh venasheviyrah shever vehashavat venifetechah-var lehaketiyn eyfah ulehagediyl shekel uleavet mozeney miremah

Hebrew: לִקְנ֤וֹת בַּכֶּ֙סֶף֙ דַּלִּ֔ים וְאֶבְי֖וֹן בַּעֲב֣וּר נַעֲלָ֑יִם וּמַפַּ֥ל בַּ֖ר נַשְׁבִּֽיר׃
Translated: and selling grain refuse as grain! We will buy the poor for silver, the needy for a pair of sandals.”
Transliteration: likenvot vakhesef daliym veeveyvon vaavur naalayiim umafal var nasheviyr

Hebrew: נִשְׁבַּ֥ע יְהֹוָ֖ה בִּגְא֣וֹן יַעֲקֹ֑ב אִם־אֶשְׁכַּ֥ח לָנֶ֖צַח כׇּל־מַעֲשֵׂיהֶֽם׃
Translated: G<small>OD</small> swears by the Pride of Jacob: “I will never forget any of their doings.”
Transliteration: nisheva yehovah vigevon yaakov im-eshekhach lanetsach khׇl-maasheyhem

Hebrew: הַ֤עַל זֹאת֙ לֹא־תִרְגַּ֣ז הָאָ֔רֶץ וְאָבַ֖ל כׇּל־יוֹשֵׁ֣ב בָּ֑הּ וְעָלְתָ֤ה כָאֹר֙ כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְנִגְרְשָׁ֥ה (ונשקה) [וְנִשְׁקְעָ֖ה] כִּיא֥וֹר מִצְרָֽיִם׃ {פ}
Translated:
Shall not the earth shake for this
And all that dwell on it mourn?
Shall it not all rise like the Nile
And surge and subside like the Nile of Egypt?
Transliteration: haal zot lo-tiregaz haarets veaval khׇl-yvoshev vah vealetah khaor khulah venigereshah (vnshkh) [venishekeah] khiyvor mitserayiim {f}

Hebrew: וְהָיָ֣ה ׀ בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֗וּא נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְהֵבֵאתִ֥י הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ בַּֽצׇּהֳרָ֑יִם וְהַחֲשַׁכְתִּ֥י לָאָ֖רֶץ בְּי֥וֹם אֽוֹר׃
Translated:
And in that day
—declares the Sovereign GOD—
I will make the sun set at noon,
I will darken the earth on a sunny day.
Transliteration: vehayah vayyvom hahu neum adonay yehovih vehevetiy hashemesh vatsׇhorayiim vehachashakhetiy laarets veyvom vor

Hebrew: וְהָפַכְתִּ֨י חַגֵּיכֶ֜ם לְאֵ֗בֶל וְכׇל־שִֽׁירֵיכֶם֙ לְקִינָ֔ה וְהַעֲלֵיתִ֤י עַל־כׇּל־מׇתְנַ֙יִם֙ שָׂ֔ק וְעַל־כׇּל־רֹ֖אשׁ קׇרְחָ֑ה וְשַׂמְתִּ֙יהָ֙ כְּאֵ֣בֶל יָחִ֔יד וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖הּ כְּי֥וֹם מָֽר׃ {פ}
Translated:
I will turn your festivals into mourning
And all your songs into dirges;
I will put sackcloth on all loins
And tonsures on every head.
I will make the earth mourn as for an only child,
All of it as on a bitter day.
Transliteration: vehafakhetiy chageykhem leevel vekhׇl-shiyreykhem lekiynah vehaaleytiy al-khׇl-mׇtenayiim shak veal-khׇl-rosh kׇrechah veshametiyha kheevel yachiyd veachariytah kheyvom mar {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֣ה ׀ יָמִ֣ים בָּאִ֗ים נְאֻם֙ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֔ה וְהִשְׁלַחְתִּ֥י רָעָ֖ב בָּאָ֑רֶץ לֹא־רָעָ֤ב לַלֶּ֙חֶם֙ וְלֹא־צָמָ֣א לַמַּ֔יִם כִּ֣י אִם־לִשְׁמֹ֔עַ אֵ֖ת דִּבְרֵ֥י יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated: A time is coming—declares the Sovereign G<small>OD</small>—when I will send a famine upon the land: not a hunger for bread or a thirst for water, but for hearing the words of G<small>OD</small>.
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum adonay yehovih vehishelachetiy raav vaarets lo-raav lalechem velo-tsama lamayiim khiy im-lishemoa et diverey yehovah

Hebrew: וְנָעוּ֙ מִיָּ֣ם עַד־יָ֔ם וּמִצָּפ֖וֹן וְעַד־מִזְרָ֑ח יְשׁ֥וֹטְט֛וּ לְבַקֵּ֥שׁ אֶת־דְּבַר־יְהֹוָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א יִמְצָֽאוּ׃
Translated: People shall wander from sea to sea and from north to east to seek the word of G<small>OD</small>, but they shall not find it.
Transliteration: venau miyam ad-yam umitsafvon vead-mizerach yeshvotetu levakesh et-devar-yehovah velo yimetsau

Hebrew: בַּיּ֨וֹם הַה֜וּא תִּ֠תְעַלַּ֠פְנָה הַבְּתוּלֹ֧ת הַיָּפ֛וֹת וְהַבַּחוּרִ֖ים בַּצָּמָֽא׃
Translated: In that day, the beautiful maidens and the young men shall faint with thirst—
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu titealafenah havetulot hayafvot vehavachuriym vatsama

Hebrew: הַנִּשְׁבָּעִים֙ בְּאַשְׁמַ֣ת שֹֽׁמְר֔וֹן וְאָמְר֗וּ חֵ֤י אֱלֹהֶ֙יךָ֙ דָּ֔ן וְחֵ֖י דֶּ֣רֶךְ בְּאֵֽר־שָׁ֑בַע וְנָפְל֖וּ וְלֹא־יָק֥וּמוּ עֽוֹד׃ {פ}
Translated:
Those who swear by the guilt of Samaria,
Saying, “As your god lives, Dan,”
And “As the way to Beer-sheba lives”—
They shall fall to rise no more.
Transliteration: hanishevaiym veashemat shomervon veameru chey eloheykha dan vechey derekhe veer-shava venafelu velo-yakumu vod {f}

Hebrew: רָאִ֨יתִי אֶת־אֲדֹנָ֜י נִצָּ֣ב עַֽל־הַמִּזְבֵּ֗חַ וַיֹּ֩אמֶר֩ הַ֨ךְ הַכַּפְתּ֜וֹר וְיִרְעֲשׁ֣וּ הַסִּפִּ֗ים וּבְצַ֙עַם֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ כֻּלָּ֔ם וְאַחֲרִיתָ֖ם בַּחֶ֣רֶב אֶהֱרֹ֑ג לֹֽא־יָנ֤וּס לָהֶם֙ נָ֔ס וְלֹֽא־יִמָּלֵ֥ט לָהֶ֖ם פָּלִֽיט׃
Translated: I observed my Sovereign standing by the altar and saying: Strike the capitals so that the thresholds quake, and make an end of the first of them all. And I will slay the last of them with the sword; not one of them shall escape, and not one of them shall survive.
Transliteration: raiytiy et-adonay nitsav al-hamizevecha vayomer hakhe hakhafetvor veyireashu hasifiym uvetsaam verosh khulam veachariytam vacherev eherog lo-yanus lahem nas velo-yimalet lahem faliyt

Hebrew: אִם־יַחְתְּר֣וּ בִשְׁא֔וֹל מִשָּׁ֖ם יָדִ֣י תִקָּחֵ֑ם וְאִֽם־יַעֲלוּ֙ הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם מִשָּׁ֖ם אוֹרִידֵֽם׃
Translated:
If they burrow down to Sheol,
From there My hand shall take them;
And if they ascend to heaven,
From there I will bring them down.
Transliteration: im-yacheteru vishevol misham yadiy tikachem veim-yaalu hashamayiim misham voriydem

Hebrew: וְאִם־יֵחָֽבְאוּ֙ בְּרֹ֣אשׁ הַכַּרְמֶ֔ל מִשָּׁ֥ם אֲחַפֵּ֖שׂ וּלְקַחְתִּ֑ים וְאִם־יִסָּ֨תְר֜וּ מִנֶּ֤גֶד עֵינַי֙ בְּקַרְקַ֣ע הַיָּ֔ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַנָּחָ֖שׁ וּנְשָׁכָֽם׃
Translated:
If they hide on the top of Carmel,
There I will search them out and seize them;
And if they conceal themselves from My sight
At the bottom of the sea,
There I will command
The serpent to bite them.
Transliteration: veim-eichaveu verosh hakharemel misham achafesh ulekachetiym veim-yisateru mineged eynay vekareka hayam misham atsaveh et-hanachash uneshakham

Hebrew: וְאִם־יֵלְכ֤וּ בַשְּׁבִי֙ לִפְנֵ֣י אֹֽיְבֵיהֶ֔ם מִשָּׁ֛ם אֲצַוֶּ֥ה אֶת־הַחֶ֖רֶב וַהֲרָגָ֑תַם וְשַׂמְתִּ֨י עֵינִ֧י עֲלֵיהֶ֛ם לְרָעָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א לְטוֹבָֽה׃
Translated:
And if they go into captivity
Before their enemies,
There I will command
The sword to slay them.
I will fix My eye on them for evil
And not for good.
Transliteration: veim-eilekhu vasheviy lifeney oyeveyhem misham atsaveh et-hacherev vaharagatam veshametiy eyniy aleyhem leraah velo letvovah

Hebrew: וַאדֹנָ֨י יֱהֹוִ֜ה הַצְּבָא֗וֹת הַנּוֹגֵ֤עַ בָּאָ֙רֶץ֙ וַתָּמ֔וֹג וְאָבְל֖וּ כׇּל־י֣וֹשְׁבֵי בָ֑הּ וְעָלְתָ֤ה כַיְאֹר֙ כֻּלָּ֔הּ וְשָׁקְעָ֖ה כִּיאֹ֥ר מִצְרָֽיִם׃
Translated:
It is the Sovereign GOD of Hosts—
At whose touch the earth trembles
And all who dwell on it mourn,
And all of it swells like the Nile
And subsides like the Nile of Egypt;
Transliteration: vadonay yehovih hatsevavot hanvogea vaarets vatamvog veavelu khׇl-yvoshevey vah vealetah khayeor khulah veshakeah khiyor mitserayiim

Hebrew: הַבּוֹנֶ֤ה בַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ מַעֲלוֹתָ֔ו וַאֲגֻדָּת֖וֹ עַל־אֶ֣רֶץ יְסָדָ֑הּ הַקֹּרֵ֣א לְמֵֽי־הַיָּ֗ם וַֽיִּשְׁפְּכֵ֛ם עַל־פְּנֵ֥י הָאָ֖רֶץ יְהֹוָ֥ה שְׁמֽוֹ׃ {פ}
Translated:
Who built the chambers in heaven
And founded the vault on the earth,
Who summons the waters of the sea
And pours them over the land—
Whose name is GOD.
Transliteration: havvoneh vashamayiim maalvotav vaagudatvo al-erets yesadah hakore lemey-hayam vayishefekhem al-feney haarets yehovah shemvo {f}

Hebrew: הֲל֣וֹא כִבְנֵי֩ כֻשִׁיִּ֨ים אַתֶּ֥ם לִ֛י בְּנֵ֥י יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֑ה הֲל֣וֹא אֶת־יִשְׂרָאֵ֗ל הֶעֱלֵ֙יתִי֙ מֵאֶ֣רֶץ מִצְרַ֔יִם וּפְלִשְׁתִּיִּ֥ים מִכַּפְתּ֖וֹר וַאֲרָ֥ם מִקִּֽיר׃
Translated:
To Me, O Israelites, you are
Just like the Cushites
—declares GOD.
True, I brought Israel up
From the land of Egypt,
But also the Philistines from Caphtor
And the Arameans from Kir.
Transliteration: halvo khiveney khushiyiym atem liy veney yisherael neum-yehovah halvo et-yisherael heeleytiy meerets mitserayiim ufelishetiyiym mikhafetvor vaaram mikiyr

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֞ה עֵינֵ֣י ׀ אֲדֹנָ֣י יֱהֹוִ֗ה בַּמַּמְלָכָה֙ הַֽחַטָּאָ֔ה וְהִשְׁמַדְתִּ֣י אֹתָ֔הּ מֵעַ֖ל פְּנֵ֣י הָאֲדָמָ֑ה אֶ֗פֶס כִּ֠י לֹ֣א הַשְׁמֵ֥יד אַשְׁמִ֛יד אֶת־בֵּ֥ית יַעֲקֹ֖ב נְאֻם־יְהֹוָֽה׃
Translated:
Behold, my Sovereign GOD is keeping an eye
On the sinful kingdom:
I will wipe it off
The face of the earth!
But, I will not wholly wipe out
The House of Jacob
—declares GOD.
Transliteration: hineh eyney adonay yehovih vamamelakhah hachataah vehishemadetiy otah meal feney haadamah efes khiy lo hashemeyd ashemiyd et-veyt yaakov neum-yehovah

Hebrew: כִּֽי־הִנֵּ֤ה אָֽנֹכִי֙ מְצַוֶּ֔ה וַהֲנִע֥וֹתִי בְכׇֽל־הַגּוֹיִ֖ם אֶת־בֵּ֣ית יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל כַּאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִנּ֙וֹעַ֙ בַּכְּבָרָ֔ה וְלֹֽא־יִפּ֥וֹל צְר֖וֹר אָֽרֶץ׃
Translated:
For I will give the order
And shake the House of Israel—
Through all the nations—
As one shakes [sand] in a sieve,
And not a pebble falls to the ground.
Transliteration: khiy-hineh anokhiy metsaveh vahanivotiy vekhׇl-hagvoyim et-veyt yisherael khaasher yinvoa vakhevarah velo-yifvol tservor arets

Hebrew: בַּחֶ֣רֶב יָמ֔וּתוּ כֹּ֖ל חַטָּאֵ֣י עַמִּ֑י הָאֹמְרִ֗ים לֹֽא־תַגִּ֧ישׁ וְתַקְדִּ֛ים בַּעֲדֵ֖ינוּ הָרָעָֽה׃
Translated:
All the sinners of My people
Shall perish by the sword,
Who boast,
“Never shall the evil
Overtake us or come near us.”
Transliteration: vacherev yamutu khol chataey amiy haomeriym lo-tagiysh vetakediym vaadeynu haraah

Hebrew: בַּיּ֣וֹם הַה֔וּא אָקִ֛ים אֶת־סֻכַּ֥ת דָּוִ֖יד הַנֹּפֶ֑לֶת וְגָדַרְתִּ֣י אֶת־פִּרְצֵיהֶ֗ן וַהֲרִֽסֹתָיו֙ אָקִ֔ים וּבְנִיתִ֖יהָ כִּימֵ֥י עוֹלָֽם׃
Translated:
In that day,
I will set up again the fallen booth of David:
I will mend its breaches and set up its ruins anew.
I will build it firm as in the days of old,
Transliteration: vayyvom hahu akiym et-sukhat daviyd hanofelet vegadaretiy et-firetseyhen vaharisotayv akiym uveniytiyha khiymey volam

Hebrew: לְמַ֨עַן יִֽירְשׁ֜וּ אֶת־שְׁאֵרִ֤ית אֱדוֹם֙ וְכׇל־הַגּוֹיִ֔ם אֲשֶׁר־נִקְרָ֥א שְׁמִ֖י עֲלֵיהֶ֑ם נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֖ה עֹ֥שֶׂה זֹּֽאת׃ {פ}
Translated:
So that they shall possess the rest of Edom
And all the nations once attached to My name
—declares GOD who will bring this to pass.
Transliteration: lemaan yiyreshu et-sheeriyt edvom vekhׇl-hagvoyim asher-nikera shemiy aleyhem neum-yehovah osheh zot {f}

Hebrew: הִנֵּ֨ה יָמִ֤ים בָּאִים֙ נְאֻם־יְהֹוָ֔ה וְנִגַּ֤שׁ חוֹרֵשׁ֙ בַּקֹּצֵ֔ר וְדֹרֵ֥ךְ עֲנָבִ֖ים בְּמֹשֵׁ֣ךְ הַזָּ֑רַע וְהִטִּ֤יפוּ הֶֽהָרִים֙ עָסִ֔יס וְכׇל־הַגְּבָע֖וֹת תִּתְמוֹגַֽגְנָה׃
Translated:
A time is coming
—declares GOD—
When the plower shall meet the reaper,
And the treader of grapes
The one who holds the [bag of] seed;
When the mountains shall drip wine
And all the hills shall wave [with grain].
Transliteration: hineh yamiym vaiym neum-yehovah venigash chvoresh vakotser vedorekhe anaviym vemoshekhe hazara vehitiyfu hehariym asiys vekhׇl-hagevavot titemvogagenah

Hebrew: וְשַׁבְתִּי֮ אֶת־שְׁב֣וּת עַמִּ֣י יִשְׂרָאֵל֒ וּבָנ֞וּ עָרִ֤ים נְשַׁמּוֹת֙ וְיָשָׁ֔בוּ וְנָטְע֣וּ כְרָמִ֔ים וְשָׁת֖וּ אֶת־יֵינָ֑ם וְעָשׂ֣וּ גַנּ֔וֹת וְאָכְל֖וּ אֶת־פְּרִיהֶֽם׃
Translated:
I will restore My people Israel.
They shall rebuild ruined cities and inhabit them;
They shall plant vineyards and drink their wine;
They shall till gardens and eat their fruits.
Transliteration: veshavetiy et-shevut amiy yisherael uvanu ariym neshamvot veyashavu venateu kheramiym veshatu et-eiynam veashu ganvot veakhelu et-feriyhem

Hebrew: וּנְטַעְתִּ֖ים עַל־אַדְמָתָ֑ם וְלֹ֨א יִנָּתְשׁ֜וּ ע֗וֹד מֵעַ֤ל אַדְמָתָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָתַ֣תִּי לָהֶ֔ם אָמַ֖ר יְהֹוָ֥ה אֱלֹהֶֽיךָ׃
Translated:
And I will plant them upon their soil,
Nevermore to be uprooted
From the soil I have given them
—said the ETERNAL your God.
Transliteration: unetaetiym al-adematam velo yinateshu vod meal adematam asher natatiy lahem amar yehovah eloheykha
